Take a look at some neat facts about the: Take a look at some neat facts about the planets you're going to orbit around!
Mercurio non \u00e8 in generale il piane: Mercurio is not the hottest planet of the Solar System, but it is the one with the widest temperature range due to the almost complete lack of atmosphere. The sunny side can reach up to 527 Celsius degrees. On the other hand the dark side is around -83 Celsius degrees.

Su Nettuno (e su Urano) non c\u2019\u00e: On Neptune (and on Uranus) there is no water (at least not in significant quantities) but it rains. And given the very high concentration of carbon it is likely that the drops have the same composition as the diamonds.
Benvenuto, qui puoi registrarti!: Welcome, you can sign up here!
Una ricerca dell'universit\u00e0 del Mar: A research by the University of Maryland hypothesizes that our planet, in the past, appeared purple and not blue. They studied that in past ages microbes could process sunlight through molecules other than chlorophyll. These molecules color the microbes of violet and therefore also our atmosphere would have appeared of that color.
Saturno \u00e8 il pianeta con la densit\: Saturn is the planet with the lowest density of the solar system: only 0.69 mg / mL, a value also lower than that of water (about 2/3). If we had a sea large enough to accommodate the entire celestial body we would see it floating like a huge iceberg.
Cos\u00ec lontano e piccolo da generare: So far and so small as to generate doubts about its planetary consistency, yet with an atmosphere. Very thin and toxic to humans, it is still an atmosphere. But what is more unique is its consistency. In fact, when the planet is in perihelion (minimum distance from the Sun) the atmosphere is gaseous, in aphelion (maximum distance from the Sun) this freezes and falls on the planet like snow.
La Luna non \u00e8 per nulla alla medesi: The Moon is not at all the same distance from the Earth since its formation: according to estimates, the satellite moves away from us by 3.78 centimeters every year.

La gravit\u00e0 di Giove \u00e8 cos\u00e: The gravity of Jupiter is so great, that it has the effect of lengthening and crushing Io. All the energy that comes from the gravitational field of Jupiter feeds the volcanoes of Io whose plumes can reach 500 km above the surface of the moon.
Si pensa che sotto la superficie di Euro: It is thought that beneath the surface of Europe there is a layer of liquid water maintained by the heat generated by the "tides" caused by the gravitational interaction with Jupiter. The surface temperature of Europa is around 110 (-163 ° C) at the equator and only 50 K (-223 ° C) at the poles, so that surface ice is permanently frozen.

Come la Terra, anche Marte manifesta 4 s: Like the Earth, Mars also manifests 4 seasons, due to its inclined axis with respect to the Sun, with an angle very similar to that of the Earth (25 degrees versus 23.5 degrees on land). However, since the year of Mars is about twice the size of ours, even the seasons last longer. Because of the distinctly elliptical trajectory, some seasons last longer than others (in the northern hemisphere, summer and spring last longer, as in the south, autumn and winter).

Un giorno venusiano dura 243 giorni terr: A Venus day is equal to 243 Earth days, meanwhile a Venus year is shorter because it's only 224,7 earth days long.
Blue Horizon is an interplanetary flight: Blue Horizon is an interplanetary flight company born back in 2103. Founders Matteo Pagotto, Manuel Pagotto, Alessandro Franchin and Stefano Baggio were classmates in University of Padua. They always have been passionate about space travelling and one day Matteo started to think about it in a more concrete way. His idea was to create a new concept of travelling, a new way to enjoy space voyages. His proposal didn't sound good to his colleagues to begin with, but after a few years of work Matteo finally drew the attention of Stefano, Manuel and Alessandro. When they started to work together the project started to grow way faster than before and finally in 2103 Blue Horizon became a real thing. From 2103 we made huge steps forward and now we are a solid choice for those who want to explore the galaxy!
Pianeta enorme e circondato di Lune: ben: Huge and surrounded planet of Lune: as many as 63 are in fact the current established natural satellites that orbit around the giant of the Solar System. Four of these were discovered in 1610 by Galileo Galilei, namely Io, Europa, Callisto and Ganimede, the latter largest in volume on the planet Mercury, but with half the mass.

A Urano non piace proprio la posizione v: Uranus does not really like the vertical position: the planet, which is inclined by 98 degrees with respect to its orbital plane around the Sun, a unique feature in the Solar System, is the seventh in order of distance from the Sun, the third by diameter and the fourth by mass.
